import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Drop 'Id' from both training and test sets
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values in numerical columns
for col in numerical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median())
    if col in X_test.columns:
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median())

# Handle missing values in categorical columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0])
    if col in X_test.columns:
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode()[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_columns),
        ('num', 'passthrough', numerical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create and train model pipeline
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100,

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.copy()
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Drop 'Id' from training and validation sets
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = X_val.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values in numerical columns
for col in numerical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median())
    if col in X_test.columns:
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median())

# Handle missing values in categorical columns

    if col in X_test.columns:

# Ensure all categorical columns are present and handle missing values properly
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if col in X_train.columns]

# One-hot encode categorical features

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.copy()
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Drop 'Id' from training and validation sets

X_val = X_val.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove any columns that are not in the training set
categorical_columns = [col for col in categorical_columns if col in X_train.columns]

# Handle missing values in numerical columns
for col in numerical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median())
    if col in X_test.columns:
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median())

import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor

from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
